topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ee9bf66368723e2d8c1800#post_54ee9bf66368723e2d8c1800
It's not just Oedipus. Greek mythology has a storied history of sons striking down their fathers. Uranus was castrated by his son Cronus. Cronus was thrown into Tartarus by his son Zeus. And the Titan Metis prophesied that if her and Zeus's child was a son, he in turn would cast down his father. So he ate her (but in that case, Metis gave birth to Athena). But I'm certain there are more examples.
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ee9bf66368723e2d8c1800#post_54ee9bf66368723e2d8c1800
